intro: Microseris bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's winterfat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Microseris bolanderi is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
